case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only
case_circumstances:
A man looking through a burned out building discovered numerous bones and called the police.  It was determined the the Unknown Adult Male had apparently climbed into a crawl space and expired at an undetermined time.  The building had been firebombed on 6-27-1973 and was gutted by fire on 3-14-1974.
Of the other items found in the building, there was a shoe much like those men wore in 1930's and a bottle of beer, which was bottled in 1938 in Cleveland.
case_head_hair: Only mandible was found - skull missing
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_footwear: According to the police report, they found "a pair of shoes that where [sic] of the type that a male might have woren [sic] in the late 30's, they where ankle high and the last three eyelets were of the hook type.
case_other_items_with_body: According to the police report there "was a beer bottle from the Royal Beer Company, Cleveland, Ohio.  This bottle was bottled in 1938."
dental: Dental information / charting is currently not available
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
